title: looking for a high energy/expressive feminine script....
content:
one of the closest i could find that was hitting a good note was indy script by letraset - anyone have any recommendations for something similar but a bit more bold? thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [indy.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/typophile.com/files/indy.jpg) | 82.18 KB |
author: justinthomaskay

comments.content:
[http://www.sudtipos.com/home](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.sudtipos.com/home "http://www.sudtipos.com/home")

Look through the list here.

steve

Some of the Joebob fonts perhaps?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=joebob](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=joebob "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=joebob")

Tim
Arguably feminine are Refreshment Stand, Lamplighter and Leisure Script from [Fontdiner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html)

Rob Leushcke's Hurricane is a tad bolder and bit looser:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gideon/hurricane/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gideon/hurricane/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gideon/hurricane/")

Michael Clark's Sweepy is tasty:  
 [http://www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=sweepy&face=sweepyot](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=sweepy&face=sweepyot "http://www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=sweepy&face=sweepyot")
Also Leuschke's [Ambiance](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=BT.122694.0.0) available in OT with swashes and alts.

[http://anatoletype.net/fonts/dolcehttp://anatoletype.net/fonts/dolce](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/anatoletype.net/fonts/dolcehttp:/anatoletype.net/fonts/dolce "http://anatoletype.net/fonts/dolcehttp://anatoletype.net/fonts/dolce")

and, bolder,

[http://anatoletype.net/fonts/dyna](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031436/http:/anatoletype.net/fonts/dyna "http://anatoletype.net/fonts/dyna")

expressive and feminine… maybe not so “high energy”
